result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley T. Dobbertin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present. 
Defendant shall not associate with individuals in possession of illegal substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with co-defendants: Michael Schrock, Jared Mande and John Cain III.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Warren Zier, ADA present. 
Attorney Genelle Johnson present. 
Defendant present - in custody. 
Plea questionnaire filed by the Court. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
Defendant enters no contest plea to count 1 in 16CM93 and count 4 in 16CM146. 
State has complied with victim notification. 
Court accepts pleas entered and finds the defendant guilty. 
Remaining counts are dismissed and read-in. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld - probation 2 years each count concurrent. 
Conditions of probation: 
- pay costs 
- pay $749.58 restitution and surcharge in 16CM93, joint/several with M. Schrock & J. Mande 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- not go upon any premises where they believe such contraband as defined in Chapter 961 may be present 
- not associate with individuals in possession of illegal substances or drug paraphernalia 
- no contact directly or indirectly with co-defendants: Michael Schrock, Jared Mande and John Cain III 
Advised of appeal rights.
